title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
U.S. consumers' moods about the economy improved in September, while a jump in new-home sales and a decline in durable-goods orders in August offered a mixed picture of demand.

The Dow industrials fell deeper into bear-market territory, shedding 0.4%, while the S&P 500 lost 0.2% and the Nasdaq rose 0.2%.

Eleven of the world's largest banks and brokerages will collectively pay $1.8 billion in fines to resolve regulatory investigations over their employees' use of messaging apps that broke record-keeping rules, regulators said.

Alex Mashinsky, co-founder and CEO of bankrupt cryptocurrency lender Celsius, is stepping down after a resignation request from the company's creditors.

An antitrust trial to determine the fate of a partnership between American Airlines and JetBlue began in federal court in Boston.

Intel plans to start selling graphics chips for videogamers next month, aiming for a piece of a market dominated by Nvidia and AMD.

What's News: Business & Finance
